method.name: GET
method.doc: Verifies whether an Amazon DevPay product code is associated with an instance. This can only be executed by the owner of the AMI and is useful when an AMI owner wants to verify whether another EC2 user's instance is eligible for support.

param.name: ProductCode
param.doc: The product code to confirm.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The instance code to confirm.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates an Amazon EBS-backed AMI from an Amazon EBS-backed instance that is in either the running or stopped state.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of the instance.

param.name: Name
param.doc: A name for the new image you're creating. Constraints: 3-128 alphanumeric characters, parenthesis (()), commas (,), slashes (/), dashes (-), or underscores(_)

param.name: Description
param.doc: A description of the new image. Constraints: Up to 255 characters

param.name: NoReboot
param.doc: By default this parameter is set to false, which means Amazon EC2 attempts to cleanly shut down the instance before image creation and reboots the instance afterwards. When the parameter is set to true, Amazon EC2 does not shut down the instance before creating the image. When this option is used, file system integrity on the created image cannot be guaranteed.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deregisters the specified AMI. Once deregistered, the AMI cannot be used to launch new instances. Note: This command does not delete the AMI.

param.name: ImageId
param.doc: ID of the API to deregister.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about an attribute of an AMI.

param.name: ImageId
param.doc: The AMI ID.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: The AMI ID attribute to get. Valid Values: description | kernel | ramdisk | launchPermission | productCodes | blockDeviceMapping

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about AMIs, AKIs, and ARIs. Images available to you include public images, private images that you own, and private images owned by other AWS accounts but for which you have explicit launch permissions.

param.name: ExecutableBy.n
param.doc: Returns AMIs for which the specified user ID has explicit launch permissions. The user ID can be an AWS account ID, self to return AMIs for which the sender of the request has explicit launch permissions, or all to return AMIs with public launch permissions.

param.name: ImageId.n
param.doc: One or more AMI IDs. By default, returns all AMIs, or only those otherwise specified.

param.name: Owner.n
param.doc: Returns AMIs owned by the specified owner. Multiple owner values can be specified. The IDs amazon and self can be used to include AMIs owned by Amazon or AMIs owned by you, respectively.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies an attribute of an AMI.

param.name: ImageId
param.doc: The AMI ID.

param.name: LaunchPermission.Add.n.UserId
param.doc: Adds the specified AWS account ID to the AMI's list of launch permissions.

param.name: LaunchPermission.Remove.n.UserId
param.doc: Removes the specified AWS account ID from the AMI's list of launch permissions.

param.name: LaunchPermission.Add.n.Group
param.doc: Adds the specified group to the image's list of launch permissions. The only valid value is "all".

param.name: LaunchPermission.Remove.n.Group
param.doc: Removes the specified group from the image's list of launch permissions. The only valid value is "all".

param.name: ProductCode.n
param.doc: Adds the specified product code to the specified Amazon S3-backed AMI. Once you add a product code to an AMI, it can't be removed.

param.name: Description.Value
param.doc: Changes the AMI's description to the specified value.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Registers a new AMI with Amazon EC2. When you're creating an AMI, this is the final step you must complete before you can launch an instance from the AMI.

param.name: ImageLocation
param.doc: Full path to your AMI manifest in Amazon S3 storage. Required if registering an Amazon-S3 backed AMI.

param.name: Name
param.doc: A name for your AMI. Constraints: 3-128 alphanumeric characters, parenthesis (()), commas (,), slashes (/), dashes (-), or underscores(_)

param.name: Description
param.doc: The description of the AMI. Constraints: Up to 255 characters.

param.name: Architecture
param.doc: The architecture of the image. Valid Values: i386 | x86_64

param.name: KernelId
param.doc: The ID of the kernel to select.

param.name: RamdiskId
param.doc: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information on whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

param.name: RootDeviceName
param.doc: The root device name (e.g., /dev/sda1, or xvda). Required if registering an Amazon EBS-backed AMI.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.DeviceName
param.doc: The device name (e.g., /dev/sdh, or xvdh). If registering an Amazon EBS-backed AMI from a snapshot, you must at least specify this field with the root device name (e.g., /dev/sda1, or xvda), and BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.SnapshotId with the snapshot ID.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.VirtualName
param.doc: The virtual device name.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the snapshot. If registering an Amazon EBS-backed AMI from a snapshot, you must at least specify this field with the snapshot ID, and BlockDeviceMapping.n.DeviceName with the root device name.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.VolumeSize
param.doc: The size of the volume, in GiBs. Required if you are not creating a volume from a snapshot.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.NoDevice
param.doc: Specifies that no device should be mapped.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination
param.doc: Whether the Amazon EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Resets an attribute of an AMI to its default value.

param.name: ImageId
param.doc: ID of the AMI.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: Attribute to reset (currently you can only reset the launch permission attribute). Valid Value: launchPermission

method.name: GET
method.doc: Displays Availability Zones that are currently available to the account.

param.name: ZoneName.n
param.doc: One or more Availability Zones.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes Regions that are currently available to the account.

param.name: RegionName.n
param.doc: One or more Availability Zones. By default, describes all Regions available to the account.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Provides information to AWS about your VPN customer gateway device.

param.name: Type
param.doc: The type of VPN connection this customer gateway supports. Valid Values: ipsec.1

param.name: IpAddress
param.doc: The Internet-routable IP address for the customer gateway's outside interface. The address must be static.

param.name: BgpAsn
param.doc: The customer gateway's Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a VPN customer gateway. You must delete the VPN connection before deleting the customer gateway.

param.name: CustomerGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the customer gateway you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your VPN customer gateways.

param.name: CustomerGatewayId.n
param.doc: A customer gateway ID. You can specify more than one in the request. By default, information about all your customer gateways is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Associates a set of DHCP options (that you've previously created) with the specified VPC. Or, associates no DHCP options with the VPC.

param.name: DhcpOptionsId
param.doc: The ID of the DHCP options you want to associate with the VPC, or "default" if you want the VPC to use no DHCP options.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC you want to associate the DHCP options with.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a set of DHCP options for your VPC.

param.name: DhcpConfiguration.n.Key
param.doc: The name of a DHCP option. See API docs for a list of valid option names.

param.name: DhcpConfiguration.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the DHCP option. See API docs for a list of valid option values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a set of DHCP options that you specify.

param.name: DhcpOptionsId
param.doc: The ID of the DHCP options set you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about one or more sets of DHCP options.

param.name: DhcpOptionsId.n
param.doc: A DHCP options set ID. You can specify more than one in the request. By default, information about all your sets of DHCP options, or only those otherwise specified, is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: The name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Attaches an Amazon EBS volume to a running instance and exposes it as the specified device.

param.name: VolumeId
param.doc: The ID of the Amazon EBS volume. The volume and instance must be within the same Availability Zone and the instance must be running.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of the instance to which the volume attaches. The volume and instance must be within the same Availability Zone and the instance must be running.

param.name: Device
param.doc: How the device is exposed to the instance (e.g., /dev/sdh, or xvdh).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a snapshot of an Amazon EBS volume and stores it in Amazon S3.

param.name: VolumeId
param.doc: The ID of the Amazon EBS volume of which to take a snapshot.

param.name: Description
param.doc: Description of the Amazon EBS snapshot. Constraint: Up to 255 characters.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new Amazon EBS volume that any Amazon EC2 instance in the same Availability Zone can attach to.

param.name: Size
param.doc: The size of the volume, in GiBs. Valid Values: 1-1024. If you're creating a volume from a snapshot and don't specify a size, the default is the snapshot size. Required if you're not creating a volume from a snapshot.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The snapshot from which to create the new volume. Required if you are creating a volume from a snapshot.

param.name: AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The Availability Zone in which to create the new volume. Use DescribeAvailabilityZones to display Availability Zones that are currently available to your account.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a snapshot of an Amazon EBS volume.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the Amazon EBS snapshot to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes an Amazon EBS volume.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the volume to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about an attribute of a snapshot. Currently the only attribute you can get describes who has permission to create a volume from the snapshot.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the Amazon EBS snapshot.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: The attribute to get. Valid Value: createVolumePermission

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about Amazon EBS snapshots available to you.

param.name: SnapshotId.n
param.doc: One or more snapshot IDs. By default, snapshots for which you have launch permissions are described.

param.name: Owner.n
param.doc: Returns snapshots owned by the specified owner. Multiple owners can be specified. Valid Values: self | amazon | AWS Account ID

param.name: RestorableBy.n
param.doc: One or more AWS accounts IDs that can create volumes from the snapshot.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes your Amazon EBS volumes.

param.name: VolumeId.n
param.doc: One or more volume IDs. By default, all volumes that you own, or only those otherwise specified are described.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Detaches an Amazon EBS volume from an instance.

param.name: VolumeId.n
param.doc: The ID of the volume.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of the instance.

param.name: Device
param.doc: The device name.

param.name: Force
param.doc: Forces detachment if the previous detachment attempt did not occur cleanly (logging into an instance, unmounting the volume, and detaching normally). This option can lead to data loss or a corrupted file system. Use this option only as a last resort to detach a volume from a failed instance. The instance will not have an opportunity to flush file system caches or file system metadata. If you use this option, you must perform file system check and repair procedures.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new import volume task using metadata from the specified disk image.

param.name: AvailabilityZone
param.doc: Availability Zone where the resulting Amazon EBS volume will reside.

param.name: Image.Format
param.doc: The file format of the disk image. Valid Values: VMDK | RAW

param.name: Image.Bytes
param.doc: Number of bytes in the disk image.

param.name: Image.ImportManifestUrl
param.doc: The manifest for the disk image, stored in Amazon S3 and presented here as an Amazon S3 presigned URL. For information about creating a presigned URL for an Amazon S3 object, read the "Query String Request Authentication Alternative" section of the Authenticating REST Requests topic in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

param.name: Description
param.doc: Optional description of the volume being imported.

param.name: Volume.Size
param.doc: The size, in GB (2^30 bytes), of an Amazon EBS volume that will hold the converted image.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds or remove permission settings for the specified snapshot.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the snapshot.

param.name: CreateVolumePermission.Add.n.UserId
param.doc: Adds the specified AWS account ID to the volume's list of create volume permissions.

param.name: CreateVolumePermission.Add.n.Group
param.doc: Adds the specified group to the volume's list of create volume permissions. The only valid value is all.

param.name: CreateVolumePermission.Remove.n.UserId
param.doc: Removes the specified AWS account ID from the volume's list of create volume pernissions.

param.name: CreateVolumePermission.Remove.n.Group
param.doc: Removes the specified group from the volume's list of create volume permissions.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Resets permission settings for the specified snapshot.

param.name: SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the snapshot.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: Attribute to reset (currently only the attribute for permission to create volumes can be reset). Valid Value: createVolumePermission

method.name: GET
method.doc: For EC2 addresses: This action acquires an Elastic IP address for use with your Amazon Web Services (AWS) account. For VPC addresses: This action acquires an Elastic IP address for use with your VPC.

param.name: Domain
param.doc: Set to vpc to allocate the address to your VPC. Valid Values: vpc. Required when allocating an address to a VPC.

method.name: GET
method.doc: For EC2 addresses: This action associates an Elastic IP address with an instance (not running in a VPC). For VPC addresses: This action associates a VPC Elastic IP address with an instance in your VPC.

param.name: PublicIp
param.doc: EC2 Elastic IP address to assign to the instance. Required for EC2 Elastic IP addresses.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The instance to associate with the IP address.

param.name: AllocationId
param.doc: The allocation ID that AWS returned when you allocated the Elastic IP address for use with Amazon VPC. Required for VPC Elastic IP addresses.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives information about Elastic IP addresses allocated to your account. This includes both EC2 and VPC Elastic IP addresses.

param.name: PublicIp.n
param.doc: One or more Elastic IP addresses. Applies only to standard (EC2) addresses.

param.name: AllocationId.n
param.doc: One or more allocation IDs corresponding to the address or addresses to describe. Applies only to VPC addresses.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: For EC2 addresses: This action associates an Elastic IP address with an instance (not running in a VPC). For VPC addresses: This action associates a VPC Elastic IP address with an instance in your VPC.

param.name: PublicIp
param.doc: EC2 Elastic IP address you want to disassociate. Required for EC2 Elastic IP addresses.

param.name: AssociationId
param.doc: Association ID corresponding to the VPC Elastic IP address you want to disassociate. Required for VPC Elastic IP addresses.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Releases an Elastic IP address allocated to your account.

param.name: PublicIp
param.doc: The EC2 Elastic IP address to release. Required for EC2 Elastic IP addresses.

param.name: AllocationId
param.doc: The allocation ID that AWS provided when you allocated the address for use with Amazon VPC. Required for VPC Elastic IP addresses.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Retrieves console output for the specified instance.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: ID of the instance.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about an attribute of an instance.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The instance ID.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: The instance attribute to get. Valid Values: instanceType | kernel | ramdisk | userData | disableApiTermination | instanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior | rootDeviceName | blockDeviceMapping | sourceDestCheck | groupSet

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about instances that you own.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs. By default, all instances, or only those otherwise specified are returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new import instance task using metadata from the specified disk image.

param.name: Description
param.doc: Description of the instance being imported.

param.name: Architecture
param.doc: Architecture of the instance. Valid Values: i386 | x86_64

param.name: SecurityGroup.n
param.doc: One or more security group names.

param.name: UserData
param.doc: User data to be made available to the instance.

param.name: InstanceType
param.doc: The instance type. Valid Values: m1.small | m1.large | m1.xlarge | c1.medium | c1.xlarge | m2.xlarge | m2.2xlarge | m2.4xlarge | t1.micro

param.name: Placement.AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The Availability Zone you want to launch the instance into. By default, EC2 chooses a zone for you.

param.name: Monitoring.Enabled
param.doc: Enables detailed monitoring for the instance.

param.name: SubnetId
param.doc: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this specifies the ID of the subnet you want to launch the instance into.

param.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
param.doc: Determines whether the instance stops or terminates on instance-initiated shutdown. Valid Values: stop | terminate

param.name: PrivateIpAddress
param.doc: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, you can optionally use this parameter to assign the instance a specific available IP address from the subnet (e.g., 10.0.0.25). By default, Amazon VPC selects an IP address from the subnet for the instance.

param.name: DiskImage.n.Image.Format
param.doc: File format of the disk image. Valid Values: VMDK | RAW

param.name: DiskImage.n.Image.Bytes
param.doc: Number of bytes in the disk image.

param.name: DiskImage.n.Image.ImportManifestUrl
param.doc: The manifest for the disk image, stored in Amazon S3 and presented here as an Amazon S3 presigned URL. For information about creating a presigned URL for an Amazon S3 object, read the "Query String Request Authentication Alternative" section of the Authenticating REST Requests topic in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

param.name: DiskImage.n.Image.Description
param.doc: Optional description of the disk image.

param.name: DiskImage.n.Volume.Size
param.doc: The size, in GB (2^30 bytes), of the Amazon EBS volume that will hold the converted image.

param.name: Platform
param.doc: The EC2 instance operating system. Valid Value: Windows

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies an attribute of an instance.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of the instance.

param.name: InstanceType.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance type to the specified value.

param.name: Kernel.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance's kernel to the specified value.

param.name: Ramdisk.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance's RAM disk to the specified value.

param.name: UserData.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance's user data to the specified value.

param.name: DisableApiTermination.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance's DisableApiTermination flag to the specified value. A value of true means you can't terminate the instance using the API (i.e., the instance is "locked"); a value of false means you can. You must modify this attribute before you can terminate any "locked" instances using the API.

param.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior.Value
param.doc: Changes the instance's InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior flag to the specified value. Valid Values: stop | terminate

param.name: SourceDestCheck.Value
param.doc: This attribute exists to enable a Network Address Translation (NAT) instance in a VPC to perform NAT. The attribute controls whether source/destination checking is enabled on the instance. A value of true means checking is enabled, and false means checking is disabled. The value must be false for the instance to perform NAT. For more information, go to NAT Instances in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide.

param.name: GroupId.n
param.doc: This attribute is applicable only to instances running in a VPC. Use this parameter when you want to change the security groups that an instance is in. The new set of groups you specify replaces the current set. You must specify at least one group, even if it's just the default security group in the VPC. You must specify the group ID and not the group name.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Requests a reboot of one or more instances.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Resets an attribute of an instance to its default value.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: ID of the instance.

param.name: Attribute
param.doc: Attribute to reset. Valid Values: kernel | ramdisk | sourceDestCheck

method.name: GET
method.doc: Launches a specified number of instances of an AMI for which you have permissions.

param.name: ImageId
param.doc: ID of the AMI you want to launch.

param.name: MinCount
param.doc: Minimum number of instances to launch. If the value is more than Amazon EC2 can launch, no instances are launched at all. Constraints: Between 1 and the maximum number allowed for your account (default: 20).

param.name: MaxCount
param.doc: Maximum number of instances to launch. If the value is more than Amazon EC2 can launch, the largest possible number above MinCount will be launched instead. Constraints: Between 1 and the maximum number allowed for your account (default: 20).

param.name: KeyName
param.doc: The name of the key pair to use.

param.name: SecurityGroupId.n
param.doc: One or more security group IDs. Required for VPC security groups; optional for EC2 security groups.

param.name: SecurityGroup.n
param.doc: One or more security group names. Valid only for EC2 security groups; for EC2 groups either a group ID or a group name is accepted.

param.name: UserData
param.doc: Base64-encoded MIME user data to be made available to the instance(s) in this reservation.

param.name: AddressingType
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated.

param.name: InstanceType
param.doc: The instance type. Valid Values: m1.small | m1.large | m1.xlarge | c1.medium | c1.xlarge | m2.xlarge | m2.2xlarge | m2.4xlarge | cc1.4xlarge | cg1.4xlarge | t1.micro

param.name: Placement.AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The Availability Zone you want to launch the instance into. By default, EC2 chooses a zone for you.

param.name: Placement.GroupName
param.doc: The name of an existing placement group you want to launch the instance into (for cluster instances).

param.name: Placement.Tenancy
param.doc: The tenancy of the instance you want to launch. An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.

param.name: KernelId
param.doc: The ID of the kernel with which to launch the instance.

param.name: RamdiskId
param.doc: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information on whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.DeviceName
param.doc: The device name (e.g., /dev/sdh, or xvdh). The device can be mapped to an EBS volume, a virtual device, or to nothing. If you are using this device to map an EBS volume, follow this with the EBS volume specific parameters. For information about block device mapping, go to Block Device Mapping in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.NoDevice
param.doc: Specifies that no device should be mapped. This parameter takes an empty string as input.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.VirtualName
param.doc: The virtual device name (e.g., /ephemeral0, /ephemeral1 etc). The count following ephemeral goes up based on your instance type. For a small image, it has an ephemeral0 (ext3, 15GB) and an ephemeral1 (swap, 1GB). For information about block device mapping, go to Block Device Mapping in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the snapshot.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.VolumeSize
param.doc: The size of the volume, in GiBs. Required if you are not creating a volume from a snapshot.

param.name: BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination
param.doc: Whether the Amazon EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

param.name: Monitoring.Enabled
param.doc: Enables monitoring for the instance.

param.name: SubnetId
param.doc: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this specifies the ID of the subnet you want to launch the instance into.

param.name: DisableApiTermination
param.doc: Specifies whether you can terminate the instance using the EC2 API. A value of true means you can't terminate the instance using the API (i.e., the instance is "locked"); a value of false means you can. If you set this to true, and you later want to terminate the instance, you must first change the disableApiTermination attribute's value to false using ModifyInstanceAttribute.

param.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
param.doc: Determines whether the instance stops or terminates on instance-initiated shutdown. Valid Values: stop | terminate

param.name: PrivateIpAddress
param.doc: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, you can optionally use this parameter to assign the instance a specific available IP address from the subnet (e.g., 10.0.0.25). By default, Amazon VPC selects an IP address from the subnet for the instance.

param.name: ClientToken
param.doc: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of the request. For more information, go to How to Ensure Idempotency in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. Constraints: Maximum 64 ASCII characters.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Starts an Amazon EBS-backed AMI that you've previously stopped.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Stops an Amazon EBS-backed instance.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

param.name: Force
param.doc: Forces the instance to stop. The instance will not have an opportunity to flush file system caches or file system metadata. If you use this option, you must perform file system check and repair procedures. This option is not recommended for Windows instances.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Shuts down one or more instances.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Attaches an Internet gateway to a VPC, enabling connectivity between the Internet and the VPC.

param.name: InternetGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the Internet gateway to attach.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new Internet gateway in your AWS account.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes an Internet gateway from your AWS account.

param.name: InternetGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the Internet gateway to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your Internet gateways.

param.name: InternetGatewayId.n
param.doc: One or more Internet gateway IDs.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Detaches an Internet gateway from a VPC, disabling connectivity between the Internet and the VPC.

param.name: InternetGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the Internet gateway to detach.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new 2048-bit RSA key pair with the specified name. The public key is stored by Amazon EC2 and the private key is returned to you.

param.name: KeyName
param.doc: A unique name for the key pair. Constraints: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes, and underscores.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes the specified key pair, by removing the public key from Amazon EC2. You must own the key pair.

param.name: KeyName
param.doc: Name of the key pair to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about key pairs available to you.

param.name: KeyName.n
param.doc: One or more key pair names. By default, all key pairs you own, or only those otherwise specified are described.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Imports the public key from an RSA key pair that you created with a third-party tool.

param.name: KeyName
param.doc: A unique name for the key pair. Constraints: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes, and underscores.

param.name: PublicKeyMaterial
param.doc: The public key. You must base64 encode the public key material before sending it to AWS.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Enables monitoring for a running instance.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Disables monitoring for a running instance.

param.name: InstanceId.n
param.doc: One or more instance IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new network ACL in a VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC where the network ACL will be created.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates an entry (i.e., rule) in a network ACL with a rule number you specify.

param.name: NetworkAclId
param.doc: ID of the ACL where the entry will be created.

param.name: RuleNumber
param.doc: Rule number to assign to the entry (e.g., 100). ACL entries are processed in ascending order by rule number. Constraints: Positive integer from 1 to 32766

param.name: Protocol
param.doc: IP protocol the rule applies to. You can use -1 to mean all protocols. Valid Values: -1 or a protocol number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs).

param.name: RuleAction
param.doc: Whether to allow or deny traffic that matches the rule. Valid Values: allow | deny

param.name: Egress
param.doc: Whether this rule applies to egress traffic from the subnet (true) or ingress traffic to the subnet (false).

param.name: CidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation (e.g., 172.16.0.0/24).

param.name: Icmp.Code
param.doc: For the ICMP protocol, the ICMP code. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol.

param.name: Icmp.Type
param.doc: For the ICMP protocol, the ICMP type. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol.

param.name: PortRange.From
param.doc: The first port in the range. Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol.

param.name: PortRange.To
param.doc: The last port in the range. Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a network ACL from a VPC.

param.name: NetworkAclId
param.doc: The ID of the network ACL to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes an ingress or egress entry (i.e., rule) from a network ACL.

param.name: NetworkAclId
param.doc: ID of the network ACL.

param.name: RuleNumber
param.doc: Rule nubmer for the entry to delete.

param.name: Egress
param.doc: Whether the rule to delete is an egress rule (true) or ingress rule (false).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about the network ACLs in your VPC.

param.name: NetworkAclId.n
param.doc: One or more network ACLs.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Filter name. See API docs for a list of allowed filter names. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of allowed filter values. By default, information about all your customer gateways or those you specify by ID is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Changes which network ACL a subnet is associated with.

param.name: AssociationId
param.doc: The ID representing the current association between the original network ACL and the subnet.

param.name: NetworkAclId
param.doc: The ID of the new ACL to associate with the subnet.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Replaces an entry (i.e., rule) in a network ACL.

param.name: NetworkAclId
param.doc: ID of the ACL where the entry will be replaced.

param.name: RuleNumber
param.doc: Rule number of the entry to replace.

param.name: Protocol
param.doc: IP protocol the rule applies to. You can use -1 to mean all protocols. Valid Values: -1 or a protocol number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs).

param.name: RuleAction
param.doc: Whether to allow or deny traffic that matches the rule. Valid Values: allow | deny

param.name: Egress
param.doc: Whether this rule applies to egress traffic from the subnet (true) or ingress traffic to the subnet (false).

param.name: CidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation (e.g., 172.16.0.0/24).

param.name: Icmp.Code
param.doc: For the ICMP protocol, the ICMP code. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol.

param.name: Icmp.Type
param.doc: For the ICMP protocol, the ICMP type. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol.

param.name: PortRange.From
param.doc: The first port in the range. Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol.

param.name: PortRange.To
param.doc: The last port in the range. Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a placement group that you launch cluster instances into.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: A name for the placement group.

param.name: Strategy
param.doc: The placement group strategy. Valid Values: cluster

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a placement group from your account.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: The name for the placement group to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about one or more placement groups in your account.

param.name: GroupName.n
param.doc: One or more placement group names.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes Reserved Instances that you purchased.

param.name: ReservedInstancesId.n
param.doc: One or more Reserved Instance IDs.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes Reserved Instance offerings that are available for purchase.

param.name: ReservedInstancesOfferingId.n
param.doc: One or more Reserved Instances offering IDs.

param.name: InstanceType
param.doc: The instance type on which the Reserved Instance can be used.

param.name: AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The Availability Zone in which the Reserved Instance can be used.

param.name: ProductDescription
param.doc: The Reserved Instance description. Instances that include "(Amazon VPC)" in the description are for use with Amazon VPC. Valid Values: Linux/UNIX | Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC) | Windows | Windows (Amazon VPC)

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

param.name: instanceTenancy
param.doc: The tenancy of the Reserved Instance offering. A Reserved Instance with tenancy of dedicated will run on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched within a VPC. Valid Values: default | dedicated

method.name: GET
method.doc: Purchases a Reserved Instance for use with your account.

param.name: ReservedInstancesOfferingId
param.doc: ID of the Reserved Instance offering you want to purchase.

param.name: InstanceCount
param.doc: The number of Reserved Instances to purchase.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Associates a subnet with a route table.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the route table.

param.name: SubnetId
param.doc: The ID of the subnet.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new route in a route table within a VPC.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the route table where the route will be added.

param.name: DestinationCidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR address block used for the destination match. For example: 0.0.0.0/0. Routing decisions are based on the most specific match.

param.name: GatewayId
param.doc: The ID of a gateway attached to your VPC. You must provide either GatewayId or InstanceId, but not both.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. You must provide either GatewayId or InstanceId, but not both.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new route table within a VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC where the route table will be created.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a route from a route table in a VPC.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the route table where the route will be deleted.

param.name: DestinationCidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR range for the route you want to delete. The value you specify must exactly match the CIDR for the route you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a new route table from a VPC.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the route table to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your route tables.

param.name: RouteTableId.n
param.doc: One or more route table IDs. By default, all route tables, or only those otherwise specified are returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Disassociates a subnet from a route table.

param.name: AssociationId
param.doc: The association ID representing the current association between the route table and subnet.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Replaces an existing route within a route table in a VPC.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the route table where the route will be replaced.

param.name: DestinationCidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR address block used for the destination match. For example: 0.0.0.0/0. The value you provide must match the CIDR of an existing route in the table.

param.name: GatewayId
param.doc: The ID of a gateway attached to your VPC. You must provide either GatewayId or InstanceId, but not both.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. You must provide either GatewayId or InstanceId, but not both.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Changes the route table associated with a given subnet in a VPC.

param.name: AssociationId
param.doc: The ID representing the current association between the original route table and the subnet.

param.name: RouteTableId
param.doc: The ID of the new route table to associate with the subnet.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds one or more egress rules to a VPC security group. This action applies only to security groups in a VPC; it's not supported for EC2 security groups.

param.name: GroupId
param.doc: ID of the VPC security group to modify.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol
param.doc: IP protocol name or number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs). Valid Values: tcp | udp | icmp or any protocol number. Use -1 to specify all.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.FromPort
param.doc: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. For the ICMP type number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.ToPort
param.doc: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code number. For the ICMP code number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupId
param.doc: Name of the destination security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. Required if modifying access for one or more destination security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.CidrIp
param.doc: CIDR range. Cannot be used when specifying a destination security group. Constraints: Valid CIDR IP address range. Required if modifying access for one or more IP address ranges.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds one or more ingress rules to a security group. This action applies to both EC2 security groups and VPC security groups.

param.name: UserId
param.doc: Deprecated.

param.name: GroupId
param.doc: ID of the EC2 or VPC security group to modify. The group must belong to your account. Required for VPC security groups; can be used instead of GroupName for EC2 security groups.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: Name of the EC2 security group to modify. Can be used instead of GroupId for EC2 security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol
param.doc: IP protocol name or number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs). EC2 security groups can have rules only for TCP, UDP, and ICMP, whereas VPC security groups can have rules assigned to any protocol number. Valid Values for EC2 security groups: tcp | udp | icmp or the corresponding protocol number (6 | 17 | 1). Valid Values for VPC groups: tcp | udp | icmp or any protocol number (go to Protocol Numbers). Use -1 to specify all.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.FromPort
param.doc: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. For the ICMP type number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.ToPort
param.doc: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code number. For the ICMP code number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.UserId
param.doc: AWS account ID that owns the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. For EC2 security groups only. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupName
param.doc: Name of the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupId
param.doc: ID of the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. For VPC security groups only. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.CidrIp
param.doc: CIDR range. Cannot be used when specifying a source security group. Constraints: Valid CIDR IP address range. Required if modifying access for one or more IP address ranges.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new security group.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: Name of the security group. Constraints: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes, and underscores.

param.name: GroupDescription
param.doc: Description of the group. This is informational only. Constraints: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes, and underscores.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: ID of the VPC. Required for VPC security groups.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a security group.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: Name of the security group to delete. Either GroupName or GroupId is required.

param.name: GroupId
param.doc: ID of the security group to delete. Required for a VPC security group; for an EC2 security group, either GroupName or GroupId is required.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about security groups in your account.

param.name: GroupName.n
param.doc: One ore more security group names. By default, all groups you own, or only those otherwise specified are described.

param.name: GroupId.n
param.doc: One or more security group IDs. By default, all groups you own, or only those otherwise specified are described.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes one or more egress rules to a VPC security group. This action applies only to security groups in a VPC; it's not supported for EC2 security groups.

param.name: GroupId
param.doc: ID of the VPC security group to modify.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol
param.doc: IP protocol name or number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs). Valid Values: tcp | udp | icmp or any protocol number. Use -1 to specify all.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.FromPort
param.doc: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. For the ICMP type number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.ToPort
param.doc: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code number. For the ICMP code number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupId
param.doc: Name of the destination security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. Required if modifying access for one or more destination security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.CidrIp
param.doc: CIDR range. Cannot be used when specifying a destination security group. Constraints: Valid CIDR IP address range. Required if modifying access for one or more IP address ranges.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes one or more ingress rules to a security group. This action applies to both EC2 security groups and VPC security groups.

param.name: UserId
param.doc: Deprecated.

param.name: GroupId
param.doc: ID of the EC2 or VPC security group to modify. The group must belong to your account. Required for VPC security groups; can be used instead of GroupName for EC2 security groups.

param.name: GroupName
param.doc: Name of the EC2 security group to modify. Can be used instead of GroupId for EC2 security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.IpProtocol
param.doc: IP protocol name or number (see Protocol Numbers section in API docs). EC2 security groups can have rules only for TCP, UDP, and ICMP, whereas VPC security groups can have rules assigned to any protocol number. Valid Values for EC2 security groups: tcp | udp | icmp or the corresponding protocol number (6 | 17 | 1). Valid Values for VPC groups: tcp | udp | icmp or any protocol number (go to Protocol Numbers). Use -1 to specify all.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.FromPort
param.doc: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. For the ICMP type number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.ToPort
param.doc: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code number. For the ICMP code number, you can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Required for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.UserId
param.doc: AWS account ID that owns the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. For EC2 security groups only. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupName
param.doc: Name of the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.GroupId
param.doc: ID of the source security group. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP address. For VPC security groups only. Required if modifying access for one or more source security groups.

param.name: IpPermissions.n.Groups.m.CidrIp
param.doc: CIDR range. Cannot be used when specifying a source security group. Constraints: Valid CIDR IP address range. Required if modifying access for one or more IP address ranges.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Cancels one or more Spot Instance requests.

param.name: SpotInstanceRequestId.n
param.doc: One or more Spot Instance request IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates the datafeed for Spot Instances, enabling you to view Spot Instance usage logs.

param.name: Bucket
param.doc: The Amazon S3 bucket in which to store the Spot Instance datafeed.

param.name: Prefix
param.doc: Prefix that is prepended to datafeed files.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes the datafeed for Spot Instances.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes the datafeed for Spot Instances.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes the Spot Instance requests that belong to your account.

param.name: SpotInstanceRequestId.n
param.doc: One or more Spot Instance request IDs.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes the Spot Instance requests that belong to your account.

param.name: StartTime
param.doc: Start date and time of the Spot Instance price history data.

param.name: EndTime
param.doc: End date and time of the Spot Instance price history data.

param.name: InstanceType.n
param.doc: The instance type to return. Valid Values: m1.small | m1.large | m1.xlarge | c1.medium | c1.xlarge | m2.xlarge | m2.2xlarge | m2.4xlarge | t1.micro

param.name: ProductDescription.n
param.doc: Filters the results by basic product description. Valid Values: Linux/UNIX | SUSE Linux | Windows. By default, returns all information.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

param.name: AvailabilityZone
param.doc: Filters the results by availability zone. eg. us-east-1a

param.name: MaxResults
param.doc: Specifies the number of rows to return. Valid Values: Integer greater than 0

param.name: NextToken
param.doc: Specifies the next set of rows to return. Valid Values: A NextToken value returned by a previous call of the API.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a Spot instance request.

param.name: SpotPrice
param.doc: The maximum hourly price for any Spot Instance launched to fulfill the request.

param.name: InstanceCount
param.doc: The maximum number of Spot Instances to launch.

param.name: Type
param.doc: The Spot Instance request type. Valid Values: one-time | persistent

param.name: ValidFrom
param.doc: Start date of the request. If this is a one-time request, the request becomes active at this date and time and remains active until all instances launch, the request expires, or the request is canceled. If the request is persistent, the request becomes active at this date and time and remains active until it expires or is canceled. By default, request is effective independently.

param.name: ValidUntil
param.doc: End date of the request. If this is a one-time request, the request remains active until all instances launch, the request is canceled, or this date is reached. If the request is persistent, it remains active until it is canceled or this date and time is reached. By default, request is effective indefinitely.

param.name: LaunchGroup
param.doc: The instance launch group. Launch groups are Spot Instances that launch together and terminate together. By default, instances are launched and terminated individually.

param.name: AvailabilityZoneGroup
param.doc: The Availability Zone group. If you specify the same Availability Zone group for all Spot Instance requests, all Spot Instances are launched in the same Availability Zone. By default, instances are launched in any available Availability Zone.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.ImageId
param.doc: The AMI ID.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.KeyName
param.doc: The name of the key pair.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroupId.n
param.doc: ID of the security group. You can use either this field or LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroup.n to specify a security group. By default, the instance uses the default security group. If you want to specify one or more security groups, you can use either LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroupId.n or LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroup.n.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroup.n
param.doc: Name of the security group. You can use either this field or LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroupId.n to specify a security group. By default, the instance uses the default security group. If you want to specify one or more security groups, you can use either LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroupId.n or LaunchSpecification.SecurityGroup.n.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.UserData
param.doc: MIME, Base64-encoded user data to make available to the instances.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.AddressingType
param.doc: Deprecated.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.InstanceType
param.doc: The instance type. Valid Values: m1.small | m1.large | m1.xlarge | c1.medium | c1.xlarge | m2.xlarge | m2.2xlarge | m2.4xlarge | t1.micro

param.name: LaunchSpecification.Placement.AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The placement constraints (Availability Zone) for launching the instances. By default, Amazon EC2 selects an Availability Zone.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.KernelId
param.doc: The ID of the kernel to select.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.RamdiskId
param.doc: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information on whether you need to specify a RAM disk and search for the kernel ID.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.DeviceName
param.doc: Describes the mapping that defines native device names to use when exposing virtual devices.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.VirtualName
param.doc: The virtual device name.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.SnapshotId
param.doc: The ID of the snapshot.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.VolumeSize
param.doc: The size of the volume, in GiBs. Required if you are not creating a volume from a snapshot.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.NoDevice
param.doc: Specifies that no device should be mapped.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.BlockDeviceMapping.n.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination
param.doc: Whether the Amazon EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

param.name: LaunchSpecification.Monitoring.Enabled
param.doc: Enables monitoring for the instance.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a subnet in an existing VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC where you want to create the subnet.

param.name: CidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR block you want the subnet to cover (e.g., 10.0.0.0/24).

param.name: AvailabilityZone
param.doc: The Availability Zone you want the subnet in. By default, AWS selects a zone for you (recommended).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a subnet from a VPC.

param.name: SubnetId
param.doc: The ID of the subnet you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your subnets.

param.name: SubnetId.n
param.doc: A subnet ID. You can specify more than one in the request. By default, information about all your subnets is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified resource or resources.

param.name: ResourceId.n
param.doc: ID of a resource to tag. For example, ami-1a2b3c4d. You can specify multiple resources to assign the tags to.

param.name: Tag.n.Key
param.doc: Key for a tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case sensitive and accept a maximum of 128 Unicode characters.

param.name: Tag.n.Value
param.doc: Value for a tag. If you don't want the tag to have a value, specify the parameter with no value, and we will set the value to an empty string. Constraints: Tag values are case sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a specific set of tags from a specific set of resources.

param.name: ResourceId.n
param.doc: ID of the resource. For example, ami-1a2b3c4d. You can specify more than one resource ID.

param.name: Tag.n.Key
param.doc: The tag's key. You can specify more than one tag to delete.

param.name: Tag.n.Value
param.doc: The tag's value. By default, if you omit this parameter, we delete the tag regardless of its value. If you specify this parameter with an empty string as the value, we delete the key only if its value is an empty string.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists your tags.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Cancels an active conversion task.

param.name: ConversionTaskId
param.doc: The ID of the task you want to cancel.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes your conversion tasks.

param.name: ConversionTaskId.n
param.doc: One ore more conversion task IDs.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a VPC with the CIDR block you specify.

param.name: CidrBlock
param.doc: The CIDR block you want the VPC to cover (e.g., 10.0.0.0/16).

param.name: instanceTenancy
param.doc: The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC. A value of default means instances can be launched with any tenancy; a value of dedicated means instances must be launched with tenancy as dedicated.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your VPCs.

param.name: VpcId.n
param.doc: The ID of a VPC you want information about. By default, information about all your VPCs, or only those otherwise specified is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new VPN connection between an existing VPN gateway and a VPN customer gateway.

param.name: Type
param.doc: The type of VPN connection. Valid Values: ipsec.1

param.name: CustomerGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the customer gateway.

param.name: VpnGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the VPN gateway.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a VPN connection.

param.name: VpnConnectionId
param.doc: The ID of the VPN connection you want to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your VPN connections.

param.name: VpnConnectionId.n
param.doc: A VPN connection ID. You can specify more than one in the request. By default, information about all your VPN connections is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Attaches a VPN gateway to a VPC.

param.name: VpnGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the VPN gateway to attach to the VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Detaches a VPN gateway from a VPC.

param.name: VpnGatewayId
param.doc: The ID of the VPN gateway you want to detach from the VPC.

param.name: VpcId
param.doc: The ID of the VPC you want to detach the VPN gateway from.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gives you information about your VPN gateways.

param.name: VpnGatewayId.n
param.doc: A VPN gateway ID. You can specify more than one in the request. By default, information about all your VPN gateways is returned.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Bundles an Amazon S3-backed Windows instance.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: The ID of the instance to bundle.

param.name: Storage.S3.Bucket
param.doc: The bucket in which to store the AMI. You can specify a bucket that you already own or a new bucket that Amazon EC2 creates on your behalf. If you specify a bucket that belongs to someone else, Amazon EC2 returns an error.

param.name: Storage.S3.Prefix
param.doc: The beginning of the file name of the AMI.

param.name: Storage.S3.AWSAccessKeyId
param.doc: The Access Key ID of the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket.

param.name: Storage.S3.UploadPolicy
param.doc: A Base64-encoded Amazon S3 upload policy that gives Amazon EC2 permission to upload items into Amazon S3 on your behalf.

param.name: Storage.S3.UploadPolicySignature
param.doc: The signature of the Base64 encoded JSON document.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Cancels a bundling operation for an Amazon S3-backed Windows instance (see BundleInstance method).

param.name: BundleId
param.doc: The ID of the bundle task to cancel.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Describes current bundling tasks for Amazon S3-backed Windows instances.

param.name: BundleId.n
param.doc: One or more bundle task IDs. By default, if no ID is specified, all bundle tasks are described.

param.name: Filter.n.Name
param.doc: Name of a filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter names.

param.name: Filter.n.Value.m
param.doc: A value for the filter. See API docs for a list of valid filter values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Retrieves the encrypted administrator password for an instance running Windows.

param.name: InstanceId
param.doc: A Windows instance ID.
